name: SetCustomLabelsForSelfHostedRunner
description:
Set custom labels for a self-hosted runner in an enterprise.

This tool updates the custom labels for a specific self-hosted runner in a GitHub enterprise, removing all previous labels. Requires an access token with `manage_runners:enterprise` scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_identifier
parameters.description: The slug or ID of the enterprise where the runner is configured. Use the slug version of the enterprise name or the enterprise ID.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: self_hosted_runner_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the self-hosted runner to update labels for.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner.

parameters.name: custom_labels
parameters.description: List of new custom labels for the runner. Use an empty list to remove all labels.

value_schema.description: The names of the custom labels to set for the runner. You can pass an empty array to remove all custom labels.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
